availability.p: Use of this public-domain resource is governed by the Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial 4.0 International License.

sourceDesc.p: No source; originally written in digital form.

body.note: Please change the ident attribute of the language tag in the header using the language codes in the ISO 639-2 specification (http://www.loc.gov/standards/iso639-2/php/English_list.php), if the language of the event is not English. Some of the most common languages: chi (Chinese languages), spa (Spanish), hin (Hindi), ara (Arabic), por (Portuguese). Please fill in the type attribute value for the event element: bibliographical, biographical, cultural, literary, political, or social.

event.label: Label/title of the event
event.desc: Date or date-range of the event Please fill in the "when" attribute values for single dates or the "from" and "to" attributes for date ranges. Attribute values consisting of dates must be formatted as: YYYY, YYYY-MM, or YYYY-MM-DD. (e.g., 2010, 2010-10, 2010-10-31) , location of the event Please look up the GeoNames entry of your location at http://www.geonames.org/. Select it from the list of results. On the resulting map, you will most likely be told that there are multiple results in the area. Click on this notice. Out of the resulting list, select the appropriate entry, usually the first or second entry. Once you click on it, you will see a numerical id at the top-right coner of the resulting popup.Copy it and paste it in the value of the ref attribute to replace the dotted line. (e.g., the ref attribute value for Edmonton is "http://www.geonames.org/5946768/")
event.note: Use multiple description tags for a multi-paragraph description.
Scholar note optional - delete if none.

listBibl.bibl: Source of event description and/or note optional - delete list bibl if none; multiple sources-separate bibl tags

note.note: To make the event more discoverable, please add at least one keyword; to add more than one keyword, an additional note element with a child term element should be created for each additional keyword.
